adjectives.description: trifling (comparative more trifling, superlative most trifling)

examples: […]  it doesn't take him long to make any of them, and he sells them for some trifling sum of money.

entries.meaning: (African-American Vernacular) Of suspicious character, typically secretive or deceitful; shady.
examples: My hand was aching to slap that silly heifer. I told her to take her trifling ass down to Burger King and get herself a job flipping burgers  […]

entries.meaning: The act of one who trifles; frivolous behaviour.
examples: He writes on the principle, of course, that in one's dotage we are privileged to return to the triflings of our infancy, and that Downing Street cannot be better employed in these days than as a chapel of ease to Eton.
